body.p: “I now try to think it a mink; yet it appeared larger and with a shorter body. It had a straight “,” low “,” bushy tail about two inches thick “,” short legs “,” and carried its tail and legs about on the same level. It was nearly “,” if not quite “,” as large as a muskrat. Has the mink such a tail?”
PE 12, pg. 346 / 2 April-31 July 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:29 / T vol. # XXIII / PDF # XV / JIX
